verses.verse: O that you were as my brother, <WH251> that sucked <WH3243> the breasts <WH7699> of my mother! <WH517> when I should find <WH4672> you without, <WH2351> I would kiss <WH5401> you; yes, <WH1571> I should not be despised. <WH937>

I would lead <WH5090> you, and bring <WH935> you into <WH413> my mother's <WH517> house, <WH1004> who would instruct <WH3925> me: I would cause you to drink <WH8248> of spiced <WH7544> wine <WH3196> of the juice <WH6071> of my pomegranate. <WH7416>
His left <WH8040> hand <WH8040> should be under <WH8478> my head, <WH7218> and his right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> should embrace <WH2263> me.
I charge <WH7650> you, O daughters <WH1323> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> that you stir <WH5782> not up, nor awake <WH5782> my love, <WH160> until <WH5704> he please. <WH2654>

Who <WH4310> is this <WH2063> that comes <WH5927> up from the wilderness, <WH4057> leaning <WH7514> on her beloved? <WH1730> I raised <WH5782> you up under <WH8478> the apple <WH8598> tree: there your mother <WH517> brought <WH2254> you forth: <WH2254> there she brought <WH2254> you forth <WH2254> that bore <WH3205> you.

Set <WH7760> me as a seal <WH2368> on your heart, <WH3820> as a seal <WH2368> on your arm: <WH2220> for love <WH160> is strong <WH5794> as death; <WH4194> jealousy <WH7068> is cruel as the grave: <WH7585> the coals <WH7565> thereof are coals <WH7565> of fire, <WH784> which has a most vehement <WH3050> flame. <WH7957>

Many <WH7227> waters <WH4325> cannot <WH3808> <WH3201> quench <WH3518> love, <WH160> neither <WH3808> can the floods <WH5104> drown <WH7857> it: if <WH518> a man <WH376> would give <WH5414> all <WH3605> the substance <WH1952> of his house <WH1004> for love, <WH160> it would utterly be contemned. <WH936>
We have a little <WH6996> sister, <WH269> and she has no <WH369> breasts: <WH7699> what <WH4100> shall we do <WH6213> for our sister <WH269> in the day <WH3117> when she shall be spoken <WH1696> for?

If <WH518> she be a wall, <WH2346> we will build <WH1129> on her a palace <WH2918> of silver: <WH3701> and if <WH518> she be a door, <WH1817> we will enclose <WH6696> her with boards <WH3871> of cedar. <WH730>
I am a wall, <WH2346> and my breasts <WH7699> like towers: <WH4026> then <WH227> was I in his eyes <WH5869> as one that found <WH4672> favor. <WH7965>

Solomon <WH8010> had a vineyard <WH3754> at Baalhamon; <WH1174> he let <WH5414> out the vineyard <WH3754> to keepers; <WH5201> every <WH376> one <WH376> for the fruit <WH6529> thereof was to bring <WH935> a thousand <WH505> pieces of silver. <WH3701>
My vineyard, <WH3754> which is mine, is before <WH6440> me: you, O Solomon, <WH8010> must have a thousand, <WH505> and those that keep <WH5201> the fruit <WH6529> thereof two hundred. <WH3967>
You that dwell <WH3427> in the gardens, <WH1588> the companions <WH2270> listen <WH7181> to your voice: <WH6963> cause me to hear <WH8085> it.
Make haste, <WH1272> my beloved, <WH1730> and be you like <WH1819> to a roe <WH6643> or <WH176> to a young <WH6082> hart <WH354> on the mountains <WH2022> of spices. <WH1314>
